intro: Galium equisetoides, commonly known as the common bedstraw, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces tiny, white to pinkish flowers in clusters, typically blooming from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are often covered in fine hairs, and it is known for its creeping growth habit, forming dense mats. Galium equisetoides is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
